intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris aculeata, commonly known as the common weed or shepherd's purse, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods and small, alternate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and thrives in temperate climates. It produces small white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its botanical features make it easily identifiable and ecologically significant in various habitats.
